gameCore

Class Edge

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • gameCore.LayoutObject
        • gameCore.Edge
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Exit

    public class Edge
extends LayoutObject
    An edge exists between 2 tiles, or a tile and the boundary of a level.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Group D, Main Author: Darrell Penner Group D Members --------------- Karen Madore Trang Pham Darrell Penner

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Edge(Tile tile1, Tile tile2, boolean crossable)
      Creates an edge, setting the two tiles and the crossable variable If the edge is between a tile and the boundary of a level, the extra tile is to be null
      Edge(Tile tile1, Tile tile2, boolean crossable, Direction direction1, Direction direction2)
      Creates the edge, and sets the edge for the two tiles in the given directions.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canCross(Character crosser)
      Checks if the given character can cross the edge
      void connectTiles(Tile tile1, Direction direction1, Tile tile2, Direction direction2)
      Sets this edge as the edge for the the two tiles in their respective given directions
      Tile cross(Tile currentTile, Character crosser)
      Places a Character on the other side of the Edge from the given Tile
      Direction getDirection1() 
      Direction getDirection2() 
      java.awt.Point getLocation1() 
      java.awt.Point getLocation2() 
      Tile getOtherTile(Tile currentTile)
      Gets the tile on the other side of the edge, given one of the tiles (the Edge can't predict which tile is known and which is wanted)
      boolean isCrossableByDefault() 
      boolean isVisited()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Edge

        public Edge(Tile tile1,
    Tile tile2,
    boolean crossable)
        Creates an edge, setting the two tiles and the crossable variable If the edge is between a tile and the boundary of a level, the extra tile is to be null
        Parameters:
        tile1 - One side of the edge
        tile2 - The other side of the edge
        crossable - True if the two tiles can be directly moved between, false otherwise

      • Edge

        public Edge(Tile tile1,
    Tile tile2,
    boolean crossable,
    Direction direction1,
    Direction direction2)
        Creates the edge, and sets the edge for the two tiles in the given directions. If the edge is between a tile and the boundary of a level, the extra tile is to be null.
        Parameters:
        tile1 - One side of the edge
        tile2 - The other side of the edge
        crossable - True if the two tiles can be directly moved between, false otherwise
        direction1 - The direction of the edge relative to tile1
        direction2 - The direction of the edge relative to tile2

    • Method Detail

      • connectTiles

        public void connectTiles(Tile tile1,
                Direction direction1,
                Tile tile2,
                Direction direction2)
        Sets this edge as the edge for the the two tiles in their respective given directions
        Parameters:
        tile1 - One side of the edge
        tile2 - The other side of the edge
        direction1 - The direction of the edge relative to tile1
        direction2 - The direction of the edge relative to tile2

      • canCross

        public boolean canCross(Character crosser)
        Checks if the given character can cross the edge
        Returns:
        True if it is possible to cross from one tile to the next, false otherwise

      • isCrossableByDefault

        public final boolean isCrossableByDefault()

      • cross

        public Tile cross(Tile currentTile,
         Character crosser)
        Places a Character on the other side of the Edge from the given Tile
        Parameters:
        currentTile - The current tile the Character resides on
        crosser - The Character crossing the edge
        Returns:
        The new tile of the Character

      • getOtherTile

        public Tile getOtherTile(Tile currentTile)
        Gets the tile on the other side of the edge, given one of the tiles (the Edge can't predict which tile is known and which is wanted)
        Parameters:
        currentTile - The originating tile
        Returns:
        The Tile on the other side of this edge
